meanings.definition: To supply an excessive amount of something.
meanings.sent1: The store was oversupplying the shelves with too many toys.
meanings.sent2: The farmer kept oversupplying the market with fresh vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally started oversupplying the soup with salt, making it inedible.
meanings.sent4: The rain was oversupplying the fields with water, causing flooding.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was oversupplying the students with homework assignments every day.

meanings.definition: The act of providing more of a product or service than is needed or demanded.
meanings.sent1: The oversupplying of goods led to a surplus in the warehouse.
meanings.sent2: The oversupplying of tickets resulted in empty seats at the concert.
meanings.sent3: The oversupplying of desserts at the party made everyone too full to dance.
meanings.sent4: The oversupplying of pamphlets caused a paper pile-up in the office.
meanings.sent5: The oversupplying of books in the library made it difficult to find a specific title.
